DOC.HEADLINE: SID WEISS ; PLAYED BASS FOR PROMINENT BIG BANDS
DOC.TEXT: Sid Weiss , 79 , bassist with most of the prominent big_bands of the 1930s and ' 40s and a fixture in Los Angeles recording_studios . Weiss , a native of Schenectady , N.Y. , studied the bass there and later with the principal bassist of the Washington , D.C. , Symphony.He joined Louie Prima ' s band in the early 1930s and during the next 20 years toured and recorded with Artie Shaw , Benny Goodman , Jerry Wald , Charlie Barnett and others . During World_War_II , Weiss performed with USO tours across the country . Most recently he had served as a deputy state labor commissioner , a field he became involved in through the American Federation of Musicians . In Colton on March 29 of the complications of heart_surgery .
